p: H. persicum L. is a perennial herb that usually grows up to 1.5–2 m. This alternate‐leaved plant has an anise‐like smell with thick and hollow stem. The leaf blades are elongated, densely haired on the lower side, glabrous on top, and pinnate with blunt‐toothed margins. The flowers with five petals and five stamens are small with pale white and lime‐green color. The fruits are broadly obovate, with slightly ridged schizocarp (Majidi & Sadati Lamardi, 2018).
